question: Question 1-07/27/2023 The THERMAL UTILIZATION FACTOR is defined as a ratio of:

answers.answer: a. the number of fast neutrons produced by fission in a generation to the number of total  neutrons produced by fission in the previous generation.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, Section 3.3.1

answers.answer: b. the number of thermal neutrons absorbed in fuel to the number of thermal neutrons absorbed in fuel and core materials.
answers.feedback: Correct

answers.answer: c. the number of fast neutrons produced by U-238 to the number of thermal neutrons absorbed in fuel.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, Section 3.3.1

answers.answer: d. the number of fast neutrons that start to slow down to the number of fast neutrons from all fissions.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, Section 3.3.1

question: Question 2-07/27/2023 The neutron count rate is 1000 cps. An experimenter inserts an experiment into the core and the count rate decreases to 725 cps. Given the initial Keff of the reactor was 0.91, what is the worth of the experiment?

answers.feedback: Correct

question: Question 6-07/27/2023 Given a reactor period of 38 seconds, approximately how long will it take power to quadruple?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: P = P_0e^t/T 4 = 1 · e^t/38 t = 38 · ln(4) t = 52.7 sec
Incorrect. REF: P = P_0e^t/T 4 = 1 · e^t/38 t = 38 · ln(4) t = 52.7 sec
Correct
Incorrect. REF: P = P_0e^t/T 4 = 1 · e^t/38 t = 38 · ln(4) t = 52.7 sec

question: Question 13-07/27/2023 The reactor is on a constant period. Which ONE of the following changes in reactor power would take the SHORTEST time?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: P = P0 e^t/τ Ln(P/P0) = t/τ Since you are looking for which would take the SHORTEST time, the ratio P/P0 must be the smallest value.
Incorrect. REF: P = P0 e^t/τ Ln(P/P0) = t/τ Since you are looking for which would take the SHORTEST time, the ratio P/P0 must be the smallest value.
Incorrect. REF: P = P0 e^t/τ Ln(P/P0) = t/τ Since you are looking for which would take the SHORTEST time, the ratio P/P0 must be the smallest value.
Correct

question: Question 16-07/27/2023 A reactor contains a neutron source of 1200 neutrons/second. If the stable total neutron production rate is 4800 neutrons/second, what is the value of k_eff?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume 2, Module 4, page 4
Correct
Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume 2, Module 4, page 4
Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume 2, Module 4, page 4

answers.answer: a. The total fraction of delayed neutrons weighted by the percent of all neutrons contributed by the fuel.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume 1, Module 1, page 30

answers.answer: b. The fraction of neutrons at thermal energies which were born as delayed neutrons.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume 1, Module 1, page 30

answers.answer: c. The total fraction of all neutrons born as delayed neutrons.
answers.feedback: Correct

answers.answer: d. The fraction of neutrons at fast energies which were born as delayed neutrons.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook, Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory, Volume 1, Module 1, page 30
